categories.lair: Lair upgrades improve the crew's lair, making it more secure, more useful, or more comfortable.
categories.training: Training upgrades improve the crew's ability to earn xp during downtime.
categories.quality: improves the quality rating of all the PCs items of that type, beyond the quality established by the crew's Tier and fine items

lair.boat-house: You have a boat, a dock on a waterway, and a small shack to store boating supplies. A second upgrade improves the boat with armor and more cargo capacity.
lair.carriage-house: You have a carriage, two goats to pull it, and a stable. A second upgrade improves the carriage with armor and larger, swifter goats. Horses are very rare in Doskvolâ€”most carriages in the city use the large Akorosian goat as their draft animal.
lair.cohort: A cohort is a gang or a single expert NPC who works for your crew. For all the details on cohorts, see the following pages.
lair.hidden-lair: Your lair has a secret location and is disguised to hide it from view. If your lair is discovered, use two downtime activities and pay coin equal to your Tier to relocate it and hide it once again.
lair.quarters: Your lair includes living quarters for the crew. Without this upgrade, each PC sleeps elsewhere, and is vulnerable when they do so.
lair.secure-lair: Your lair has locks, alarms, and traps to thwart intruders. A second upgrade improves the defenses to include arcane measures that work against spirits. You might roll your crew's Tier if these measures are ever put to the test, to see how well they thwart an intruder.
lair.vault: Your lair has a secure vault, increasing your storage capacity for coin to 8. A second upgrade increases your capacity to 16. A separate part of your vault can be used as a holding cell.
lair.workshop: Your lair has a workshop appointed with tools for tinkering and alchemy, as well as a small library of books, documents, and maps. You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving your lair.
lair.quality: Each upgrade improves the quality rating of all the PCs' items of that type, beyond the quality established by the crew's Tier and fine items. You can improve the quality of Documents, Gear (covers Burglary Gear and Climbing Gear), Arcane Implements, Subterfuge Supplies, Tools (covers Demolitions Tools and Tinkering Tools), and Weapons. So, if you are Tier 0, with fine lockpicks (+1) and the Quality upgrade for gear (+1), you could contend equally with a Tier II quality lock.

training.insight: Earn 2 xp (instead of 1) when you train your Insight during downtime.
training.prowess: Earn 2 xp (instead of 1) when you train your Prowess during downtime.
training.resolve: Earn 2 xp (instead of 1) when you train your Resolve during downtime.
training.personal: Earn 2 xp (instead of 1) when you train your Playbook during downtime.
training.mastery: Your crew has access to master level training. You may advance your action ratings to 4 (until you unlock this upgrade, PC action ratings are capped at 3). This costs four upgrade boxes to unlock.

quality.documents: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's documents.
quality.gear: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's Burglary Gear and Climbing Gear.
quality.implements: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's Arcane Implements.
quality.supplies: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's Subterfuge Supplies.
quality.tools: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's Demolitions Tools and Tinkering Tools.
quality.weapons: Improves the quality rating of all the crew's weapons.

districts.name: Brightstone
districts.blurb: The grand mansions and luxury shops of the wealthy elite.

districts.name: Charterhall
districts.blurb: The city's civic offices and the hub for shops, artisans, and commerce.

districts.name: Six Towers
districts.blurb: A formerly rich district, now worn down and dilapidated.

districts.name: Silkshore
districts.blurb: The 'red lamp district' and artist community.

districts.name: Nightmarket
districts.blurb: The trade center for exotic goods imported by rail. Many vendors also trade in illicit goods.

districts.name: Crow's Foot
districts.blurb: A cramped neighborhood of multi-level streets, ruled by gangs.

districts.name: The Docks
districts.blurb: Rough taverns, tattoo parlors, fighting pits, and warehouses.

districts.name: Barrowcleft
districts.blurb: Residences and markets for the farmers who work the fields and eeleries.

districts.name: Coalridge
districts.blurb: The remnants of Doskvol's original hilltop mining settlement, now home to laborers and industrial factories.

districts.name: Charhollow
districts.blurb: A maze of tenements and squalid row houses.

districts.name: Dunslough
districts.blurb: A labor camp served by convicts and a ghetto for the destitute poor.
